title: Technavio Says the Growing Demand for Integrated Circuits Will Enhance the Semiconductor Foundry Service Market in Taiwan Through 2019
text:
Finance Search 
Sat, Jul 25, 2015, 1:28 AM AEST - Australia Markets closed Technavio Says the Growing Demand for Integrated Circuits Will Enhance the Semiconductor Foundry Service Market in Taiwan Through 2019 Press Release : Technavio – 53 minutes ago Recommend Print 
LONDON--(BUSINESSWIRE)-- Technavio, a tech-focused research firm, has published a new report on the semiconductor foundry service market in Taiwan ,which is expected to grow at a CAGR of more than 4% from 2015-2019. 
According to the new Technavio report, the growing demand for integrated circuits (IC) in premium cars and several industries that deploy advanced sensor technology will propel the growth of the semiconductor industry during the forecast period. The growing demand for ICs is expected to drive investments in manufacturing capacities, leading to large-scale production of semiconductor chips, which are primarily manufactured in Taiwan. 
“The foundry capacities in Taiwan are expected to account for about 70% of the semiconductor industry during the forecast period,” says Faisal Ghaus, Vice President of Technavio. 
The report also indicates that the next big things for integrated circuits (IC) are Internet of things, smartwatches, and augmented reality. Foundries in the region are expected to manufacture ICs for these applications in the next 2-3 years. 
“Foundry services such as Taiwan semiconductor manufacturing company are developing new processes like fully depleted silicon-on-insulator technology to meet the requirement for chipsets in smart devices,” adds Ghaus. 
Technavio currently has more than 3000 market research reports on a huge range of topics, including:
